title: The Variant Hunters: Inside South Africa’s Effort to Stanch Dangerous Mutations
content: Scientists in a cutting-edge laboratory do part of the work. Local health workers on foot do the rest.

content: More states are finding cases of the new variant. Tracking its spread, experts say, is key to understanding what threat it poses.

title: Upstate New York Hospitals Are Overwhelmed as Covid Cases Surge
content: Health care officials say a “perfect storm” of new Covid cases, staff shortages and filled nursing homes has created a crisis.

title: How do you say ‘Omicron’?
content: Unlike Alpha, Beta and Delta, the name of the latest known variant is not as straightforward, with some English speakers offering up diverse pronunciations.

title: In the Michigan Shooting, What Is the School’s Responsibility?

title: Parents of Michigan Shooting Suspect Arrested in Detroit, Police Say

title: Fearing a Repeat of Jan. 6, Congress Eyes Changes to Electoral Count Law
content: Members of the special House committee investigating the Capitol riot are among those arguing for an overhaul of a more than century-old statute enacted to address disputed elections.

more_info.byline: By Luke Broadwater and Nick Corasaniti

title: The Abortion I Didn’t Have
content: I never thought about ending my pregnancy. Instead, at 19, I erased the future I had imagined for myself.

title: Big Contracts, Big Buyouts, Big Pressure: College Football Coaches Hit the Jackpot
content: Brian Kelly will earn at least $9 million a year at L.S.U., which is paying its old coach almost $17 million to step aside. Top universities have become steppingstones to other top gigs.

title: At Jackson State, the ‘Prime Effect’ Reverberates
content: In his first full season as the football coach, Deion Sanders has guided the Tigers to the conference championship game and energized a community. He says he’s just getting started.

title: Israeli Company’s Spyware Is Used to Target U.S. Embassy Employees in Africa
content: The hack is the first known case of the spyware, known as Pegasus, being used against American officials.

title: Public Displays of Resignation: Saying ‘I Quit’ Loud and Proud
content: People aren’t just leaving their jobs. They are broadcasting it.

content: A climbing award that may be a winner’s last. Also in this edition: the great “West Side Story” debate, and a look at luxury senior housing.

content: Did you follow the news this week? Take our quiz to see how well you stack up with other Times readers.

title: Denzel Washington, Man on Fire
content: The actor never leans in — he’s all in. And in his latest, “Macbeth,” conjured by Joel Coen, he is as sharp and deadly as a dagger.

content: What should you get for all the beloved but quirky, picky, fancy, practical or eccentric people in your life? Let our experts help.

title: How Staying Physically Active May Protect the Aging Brain
content: Simple activities like walking boost immune cells in the brain that may help to keep memory sharp and even ward off Alzheimer’s disease.

content: It’s good to acknowledge our past and our diversity.

content: Vaccine hesitancy reflects a transformation of people’s core beliefs about what we owe each other.
